name: Corner Cupboard (Encoignure)
maker: Carcass and mounts attributed to Jean-Pierre Latz, Marquetry panels attributed to the Workshop of Jean-François Oeben
description: Corner Cupboard (Encoignure); Carcass and mounts attributed to Jean-Pierre Latz (French, about 1691 - 1754), Marquetry panels attributed to the Workshop of Jean-François Oeben (French, born Germany, 1721 - 1763, master 1761); Paris, France; about 1750 - 1755; Oak veneered with amaranth, stained sycamore, boxwood, and rosewood; gilt-bronze mounts; breche d'Alep marble top; 97.2 x 85.7 x 58.7 cm (38 1/4 x 33 3/4 x 23 1/8 in.); 72.DA.39.2; J. Paul Getty Museum, Los Angeles, California
title: Corner Cupboard (Encoignure)
medium: Oak veneered with amaranth, stained sycamore, boxwood, and rosewood; gilt-bronze mounts; breche d'Alep marble top
